children.name: towards a main point of the compass
east a2
examples: _we'll drive east for a few more miles, then turn south.
_they were the first people to travel eastofthe mountains (= into the area beyond and to the east of the mountains) .
_we walkeddue(= directly) east for two kilometres.
_the gardenfaceseast, so we'll get the morning sun.

children.name: west a2
examples: _godue(= directly) west until you see a lake.

children.name: south a2
examples: _he travelleddue(= directly) south, towards the desert.

children.name: north a2
children.definition: north,alsonorthadverb về hướng bắc,theo hướng bắc
examples: _the gardenfacesnorth and doesn't get much sun in winter.

children.name: east a2
children.definition: east,alsoeastnoun (written abbreviatione) hướng đông; phía đông
examples: the direction from which the sun rises in the morning, opposite to the west
_the points of the compass are north, south, east and west.
_most of the country, except the east, is rural.
_according to the map, the village lies about 10 kmtothe eastofhere.

children.name: west a2
examples: the direction in which the sun goes down in the evening, opposite to the east
_the points of the compass are north, south, east and west.
_the sun risesin theeast and setsin thewest.
_most of the country will be dry tomorrow, butthewest will have some rain.

children.name: south a2
examples: the direction which goes towards the part of the earth below theequator, opposite to the north,
_the points of the compass are north, south, east and west.

children.name: north a2
examples: the direction which goes towards the part of the earth above theequator, opposite to the south,
_the points of the compass are north, south, east and west.
_the countryside is more mountainousin thenorth (ofthe country).

children.name: in a paticular part of sth according to the compass
east a2
examples: in or forming the east part of something
_the east wall of the mosque is covered with a beautiful mosaic.

children.name: west a2
children.definition: west,alsowestadjective(written abbreviationw)ở phía tây/về phía tây
examples: in or forming the west part of something

children.name: south a2
examples: in or forming the south part of something
_these plants grow well on a south-facingwall.

children.name: north a2
children.definition: north,alsonorthadjective ở phía bắc,miền bắccủa ( cái gì )
examples: in or forming the north part of something
_our farm is a few miles north of the village.

children.name: western b1
children.definition: western,alsowesternadjectivedirectionở phía tây/ đến từ phía tây của một nơi
examples: (written abbreviationw) in or from the west of a place

children.name: eastern b1
children.definition: eastern,alsoeasternadjective (written abbreviatione)ở phía đông,từ hướng đông
examples: in or from the east part of an area
_the eastern part of the country is very mountainous.
_until about 1991, the easternblocwas the soviet union and the communist countries ofeastern europe.
_buddhism and other eastern (= asian) religions fascinate me.

children.name: northern b1
children.definition: northern,alsonorthernadjective ở phía bắc,miền bắccủa ( vùng nào )
examples: in or from the north part of an area

children.name: southern b1
examples: in or from the south part of an area

children.name: in the part between two main points of the compass
northeast b1
children.definition: northeastadjective ở phíađông bắc/về hướng đông bắc

children.name: northwest b1
examples: _the sale of the company's northwest division

children.name: southwest b1
examples: _i come from the southwest part of the island.
_they moved southwest in an attempt to find better land.

children.name: towards the direction between two main points of the compass
northeast b1
children.definition: northeastadverb ở phíađông bắc/về hướng đông bắc

children.name: northwest b1
examples: _the sale of the company's northwest division

children.name: southwest b1
examples: _i come from the southwest part of the island.
_they moved southwest in an attempt to find better land.

children.name: one of the four directions between two main points of the compass
southeast b1
examples: the direction which is between south and east

children.name: southwest b1
examples: the direction which is between south and west

children.name: northeast b1
examples: the direction which is between north and east

children.name: northwest b1
examples: the direction which is between north and west

children.name: point c2
children.definition: point one of the marks on a compass that shows direction, such as north, south, east and west : phương
examples: soldiers were advancing on us from all points of the compass.
cardinal point[c]british english technicalone of the four main points (north, south, east, or west) on a compass

children.name: compass x
children.definition: compass an instrument that shows directions and has a needle that always points north : la bàn
examples: the points of the compass/compass points(= the marks that show you north, south, east etc )she was teaching the children the points of the compass.
a map and compassalways take a map and compass with you in the mountains.
the compass needle(= the long piece of metal that moves to show north )
a compass bearing/reading(= a direction shown by a compass )we took a compass bearing to ensure we were walking in the right direction.
compass errortheir ship had sailed off course due to compass errors.
use a compasssome of the kids were learning how to use a map and compass.
set a compass(= adjust it so that the needle and the north mark are in line with each other )wait until the needle settles, then set the compass.
a compass shows somethingour compass showed that we should bear right.

children.name: needle x
children.definition: needle on a compass or measuring device, the thin moving part which points in a particular direction or points to a particular measurement : kim chỉ
examples: the needle on a compass always points to magnetic north.
